availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Chandler (Hopkins County, Webster County, KY, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Eliza J. Chandler. Father of Martha Chandler, Mary A. Chandler, and Sarah Chandler. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Samuel Byrd as a laborer in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Employed Henry Campbell as a farmer in Webster County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 2, p. 155B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 507.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 481A.
"William M. Chandler (1829-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #69959014, accessed December 9, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69959014.
